subject: World Cup 2014 (Soccer)
Soccer
lead_paragraph: Even as an injury-prone, 36-year-old substitute, Germany’s Miroslav Klose has shown his ability to score goals, as he did against Ghana on Saturday to give the Germans a 2-2 draw and tie the World Cup scoring record.
snippet: Even as an injury-prone, 36-year-old substitute, Germany’s Miroslav Klose has shown his ability to score goals, as he did against Ghana on Saturday to give the Germans a 2-2 draw and tie the World Cup scoring record.
